title: How to Add a Signature to Google Docs on Mobile & Desktop

steps.title: Go to https://docs.google.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://docs.google.com/ in a web browser. If you aren't already logged into your Google account , do so now. Open the document you want to sign.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This is in the toolbar at the top.

steps.title: Click Drawing.
steps.content: Click Drawing . You can find this under Table .

steps.title: Click New.
steps.content: Click New . A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Click the down-arrow next to the Line icon.
steps.content: Click the down-arrow next to the Line icon. This will expand a menu.

steps.title: Click Scribble.
steps.content: Click Scribble . The cursor will change. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Draw your signature.
steps.content: Draw your signature. Click and drag your cursor to draw your signature. If you make a mistake, click the back arrow to undo it. The signature can be resized later.

steps.title: Click Save and close.
steps.content: Click Save and close . This is in the top-right corner. The signature will be added to your document.

steps.title: Edit the signature (optional).
steps.content: Edit the signature (optional). You can adjust the size and position of the signature if needed. To move the signature, click it to open the options. Select a text wrapping position, such as Behind text , In front of text , or other. Then, click and drag the signature where you want it. To resize the signature, click it. Then, click and drag one of the corner squares outwards to make it bigger, or drag it inwards to make it smaller.

steps.title: Prepare your signature image.
steps.content: Prepare your signature image. Since you can't draw directly in the Google Docs app, you must first draw your signature in a separate app, and then take a screenshot of it to insert it. Do the following: Open any app that allows drawing, such as Notes . Tap the Draw icon. Draw your signature. Take a screenshot of your signature.

steps.title: Open a document in the Google Docs app.
steps.content: Open a document in the Google Docs app. If you aren't already logged into your Google account, do so now.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon. This is at the bottom-right corner. You'll enter editing mode.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . You can find this in the top-right corner. The Insert menu will expand on the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Image.
steps.content: Tap Image . This is below Comment .

steps.title: Tap From photos.
steps.content: Tap From photos . If Google Docs does not have permission to access your photos, you'll need to enable it now.

steps.title: Select your photo and tap Add.
steps.content: Select your photo and tap Add . The signature will be added to the document.

steps.title: Edit the photo.
steps.content: Edit the photo. You can adjust the size and position of the signature if needed. To move the signature, tap it to open the options on the bottom. Select a text wrapping position, such as Behind text , In front of text , or other. Then, tap and drag the signature where you want it. To resize the signature, tap it. Then, tap and drag one of the corner squares outwards to make it bigger, or drag it inwards to make it smaller.

steps.title: Install a document signing add-on in Google Docs.
steps.content: Install a document signing add-on in Google Docs. On the desktop version of Google Docs, you can also use other signing tools to add your signature to a Google Doc, including DocuSign (the most common) and alternatives like DropBox Sign (formerly HelloSign) and SignEasy. Here's how: Open the Google Doc you want to sign. Click the Extensions menu. Select Add-ons > Get add-ons . Search for a specific add-on like DocuSign, or type sign to check out your options. Click Install to get the add-on. Once installed, run the add-on by clicking the Extensions menu and selecting the add-on by name.

steps.title: Sign with a PDF reader.
steps.content: Sign with a PDF reader. If you have Acrobat DC (Reader) or another PDF program that supports signing documents installed on your computer, you use it to sign a Google Doc. You'll just need to download the Google Doc as a PDF and open it in your PDF reader. To download the DOC as a PDF, click the File menu, select Download , select PDF , and save the file. Open the PDF in Acrobat Readerâ€”if it's not your default PDF viewer, right-click or control-click the PDF, select Open with , then choose Adobe Acrobat DC . Click the pen tool to sign.
